page.title: 07FARMING IN GRINDLETON
page.content: Farms in this area are situated betw- een 215 and 1,000 feet above sea level and are only suitable for grass produ- ction.The average farm is about 80 acres,(small compared to other parts of the country).The land is undulating and supports beef,sheep and dairy cows.Now only a few dairy farms remain due to competition from larger enterprises which can produce milk more efficiently.Now farms are becoming more intensive-more animals are kept on less acreage-and therefore grassland has to be kept in top condi- ion by re-seeding old pastures and keeping weeds under control.Artificial fertilisers are used to produce more grass.Nowadays most farms make silage with just a small amount of hay.This requires less labour and is more suited to our climate-the average annual rain- fall is 71 inches.
